intro: [WRONG START] Rubus hyosericeus var. fumeolus, commonly known as the smoky bramble, is a variant of the bramble genus Rubus. It is characterized by its hairy, thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The flowers are typically white or pale pink, and the plant produces small, edible berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodlands and along stream banks. This species is notable for its unique smoky fragrance, which is more pronounced in its flowers.
